question.q: Which of the following is the best definition of intersexed individuals?
question.a: people who are addicted to sex
question.b: people who have a gender identity crisis
question.c: people who are born with ambiguous genitalia
question.d: people who self-identify as being feminist

question.q: __ believed that people behave according to drives and unconscious cognitions.
The __ stage is when children begin to take on the roles of others.
The id refers to
question.c: the intermediary between norms and drives.

question.q: This term makes reference to the fact that women disproportionately live in poverty:
Parents assigning different chores to daughters and sons is an example of
By stressing societal norms and values, and by working to socialize next generations, formal and informal education both to contribute to social
Research finds that mothers respond more quickly to the cries of their baby girls than their baby boys. How would a sociologist explain this difference?
question.a: Girls are more needy than boys.
question.b: Mothers love and connect with their daughters more than their sons.
question.c: Mothers' responses to their children are influenced by ideas of gender—it's okay for girls to cry, but 'big boys don't cry.'
question.d: Girls' cries are higher pitched and irritating than boys' cries so mothers are more likely to respond quickly to end the crying of girls.

question.q: According to functionalists, men perform the __ role and women perform the __ role.
The institution of education is responsible for the transmission of all of the following except
Socialization refers to
question.a: the process that stops in early childhood in which we learn our culture, develop our personalities, and become functioning members of society.
question.b: the process that stops at middle age in which we learn our culture, develop our personalities, and become functioning members of society.
question.c: the lifelong process in which we learn our culture, develop our personalities, and become functioning members of society.
question.d: the process that limits how we learn our culture, develop our personalities, and become functioning members of society.

question.q: Which of the following is the best definition of exchange theory?
question.a: Women should be encouraged to enter male-dominated fields of work.
question.b: Aboriginal women and minority women earn less than white women.
question.c: Power flows from bringing resources to a relationship.

question.q: Which of the following is the best definition of the sociological understanding of gender?
question.a: determination of male or female on the basis of a set of socially agreed-upon biological criteria
question.b: human population can be divided into two binary constructions—male and female
question.c: socially constructed characteristics associated with masculinity and femininity
question.d: feminist social action theory that aims for the elimination of sexual division of labour

question.q: Rhonda believes that social resources are distributed fairly on the basis of who deserves what, and thus students who do not succeed in formal education deserve to occupy less socially valued positions. Such thinking is an example of
The phrase 'chilly climate' refers to
question.a: women's experiences of gender inequality in the workplace.
question.b: women's experiences of gender inequality on university campuses.

question.q: Which of the following best describes the nature versus nurture debate?
question.b: how we should nurture the environment
question.c: different ways individuals act toward one another

question.q: Post-structuralist theory views gender as
question.c: shaped by our interactions with others

question.q: Persons who live as the gender they identify as being, with or without sex reassignment procedures, are known as
Sociologists refer to all of the individuals, groups, and social institutions that develop people as functioning members of society as
Mead's term for the compilation of attributes that we associate with the average member of society is
Ideology refers to
question.d: beliefs and values that support social stratification.

question.q: Less overt aspects of schooling that nonetheless influence and shape students by teaching them to value such things as obedience and competition is referred to by sociologists as the __ curriculum.
The self-fulfilling prophecy refers to
question.b: if a person believes something to be real, it will have real consequences.
question.c: how individuals strive for what they wish to be.
question.d: how individuals sometimes come to embody what they are labelled.

question.q: Industrialization and immigration paved the way for __ education.

When a teacher holds low expectations of a given student or set of students, s/he risks perpetuating the phenomenon known as
This phrase has been used to draw attention to the lack of warmth or encouragement that girls and women often feel in school as a result of sexism.
A closed system refers to
question.a: a system that is based on ascribed status.
question.b: a system that is based on achieved status.
question.c: a system that is closed to foreigners.

question.q: Which sociologist discussed the generalized other?
Connell identifies the two culturally dominant forms of masculinity and femininity as __ masculinity and __ femininity.

An action-oriented educational and political strategy for institutional and systemic change that addresses the issue of racism and the interlocking systems of social oppression is known by this category:
A young woman who grows up in a poor family, wins a scholarship to university, and becomes a successful lawyer is an example of which type of mobility?

__ refers to all of the unconscious, informal, and unwritten rules that reinforce and maintain social conventions within a school environment.
What tends to be an organizing principle in heterosexual marriages?
The fact that women are often times paid less than men for the same job is an example of
question.d: a just system based on equality of opportunity

question.q: Who was interested in how inequality is reproduced in culture and how aspects of culture contribute to its reproduction?

Exploring how teachers' categorization of students affects students' experiences of education as well as their opportunities for achieving success in school best reflects which sociological perspective?
As a conflict theorist, Engels argued that gender stratification in capitalist societies was a direct result of
question.c: the different roles that men and women perform
